{"id":1235836928,"question_id":463,"lang":"java","lang_name":"Java","time":"1 month, 3 weeks","timestamp":1713454404,"status":10,"status_display":"Accepted","runtime":"4 ms","url":"/submissions/detail/1235836928/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Island Perimeter","memory":"45 MB","code":"public class Solution {\n   public int islandPerimeter(int[][] grid) {\n        \n        int rows = grid.length;\n        int cols = grid[0].length;\n        \n        int up, down, left, right;\n        int result = 0;\n        \n        for (int r = 0; r < rows; r++) {\n            for (int c = 0; c < cols; c++) {\n                if (grid[r][c] == 1) {\n                    if (r == 0) { up = 0; }\n                    else { up = grid[r-1][c]; }\n                     \n                    if (c == 0) { left = 0; } \n                    else { left = grid[r][c-1]; }\n                        \n                    if (r == rows-1) { down = 0; }\n                    else { down = grid[r+1][c]; }\n                        \n                    if (c == cols-1) { right = 0; }\n                    else { right = grid[r][c+1]; }\n                        \n                    result += 4-(up+left+right+down);\n                }\n            }\n        }\n\n        return result;\n    }\n}","compare_result":"","title_slug":"island-perimeter","has_notes":false,"flag_type":1}
